intro: Pedicularis gracilis var. sinensis, commonly known as the Chinese beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky habitats at high elevations. Its flowers are tubular with two lips, and it is pollinated primarily by bees and butterflies. It is a perennial herb that thrives in cool, moist environments.
